Title: UNILAG’s oldest Ph.D holder, Duyile, now a professor
Summary: Wesley University, Ondo has elevated Dr. Dayo Duyile to full Professor . Wesley University has fulfilled all academic requirements for the post .

Title: Funeral rites for Esther Effiong begin Dec. 4
Summary: Pastor (Mrs.) Esther Okon Willie Effiong  (nee Esther Monday Udo) a.k.a. (EMU) died recently at the age of 63 . Funeral rites for Pastor (Dr. Esther Ok on Willie Effionsiong begin Dec. 4 .

Title: Kosofe Chamber Of Commerce members visit Area H Police Command in Ogudu
Summary: Kosofe Chamber of Commerce and Industry members paid a courtesy visit to the Nigeria Police Force Area H . The President and executive members of the Chamber visited Area H Police Command in Ogudu .

Title: Nigerians spend N21.8 trn on petrol in 12 months
Summary: Nigerians spend N21.8 trn on petrol in 12 months . Nigeria’s struggle to attain domestic energy security is far from being overcome after a fresh data released by the Federal Government .

Title: Nurul-lslam marks 50 years of islamic dawah, pledges to bridge faith, western education
Summary: Nurul-lslam Arabic and Islamic Training Centre, Lagos, has begun the commemoration of its golden years . Nurul Llam marks 50 years of islamic dawah, pledges to bridge faith, western education .

Title: FG issues NOTAM as Nigeria prepares for inaugural Int’l airshow
Summary: FG issues NOTAM as Nigeria prepares for inaugural Int’l airshow . Federal Government has issued a Notice to Airmen (NOTAM) restricting flights into Abuja during aerial displays scheduled for the Nigeria International Airshow .

Title: Guinea-Bissau incident not coup, but more painful than losing to Buhari – Jonathan
Summary: Former President Goodluck Jonathan said Guinea-Bissau incident was not a coup . He insisted that the election results be announced . Jonathan described the incident as more painful than when he had to call late Muhammadu Buhari .

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, November 29, 2025
Summary: The U.S. dollar is trading at ₦1,446.9 in the official Nigerian Foreign Exchange Market (NFEM) window today .

Title: NTIFE 2025: Tourism Minister, Musawa, calls for partnership, investment in Nigeria cultural tourism assets
Summary: Minister of Arts, Culture, Tourism and Creative Economy, Barrister Hannah Musa Musawa, has reiterated call for strategic partnerships and collaboration with the private sector . She invites investors to invest in Nigeria's cultural tourism assets .

Title: Arik Air to exhibit at maiden Nigeria International Airshow
Summary: Nigerian carrier, Arik Air, has concluded plans to exhibit at the inaugural Nigeria International Airshow . The event is scheduled to take place from December 2 to 4, 2025, in Abuja .

Title: My brother was killed over false accusation – Cousin
Summary: Solomon Odeh was a site engineer at Eko Atlantic construction in Lagos State . He was allegedly mistaken for a thief by some private security personnel . His body was recovered from a canal on Sunday after scavengers found his body in the canal .

Title: Jimoh Ibrahim urges Nigerians to support Tinubu's economic, security reforms
Summary: Senator representing Ondo South, Jimoh Ibrahim, has urged Nigerians to unite behind President Bola Tinubu’s economic and security reform agenda . Ibrahim said the President’�s policies on economic restructuring and national security require the collective commitment of citizens if they are to achieve their intended impact . He said patriotism and

Title: Veteran actor Lere Paimo is alive — ANTP
Summary: The Association of Nigeria Theatre Arts Practitioners has debunked circulating reports claiming that veteran Yoruba actor, Olalere OsunPaimo is dead . The ANTP confirmed that the actor, popularly known as Baba Eda Onile Ola, is alive and in good health .

Title: Oyo college debunks viral picture, says campus not under siege
Summary: The management of the Oyo State College of Agriculture and Technology, Igboora, has dismissed a viral Artificial Intelligence-generated image circulating online purporting to show militants at the institution’s entrance . Management urged the public to disregard what it called a “false and cruel post” circulated by “mischief makers whose

Title: Freed 38 Kwara church worshippers still held in Ilorin
Summary: The Christ Apostolic Church, Oke Isegun, Eruku, Kwara State, was abducted by bandits on November 18 during a special thanksgiving service . The worshippers were released last Sunday and taken to Ilorin by government officials . Days after their release, the worshippers have not been reunited with their families .
